summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff regarding travel approval and logistics for an international trip to Stockholm, Sweden, to conduct an interview as part of the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). It details requests for flight and hotel bookings, including seeking approval to exceed the government per diem for a hotel, and references several prior domestic trips for the same investigation.

persons.name: Dale
persons.context: Receives email confirmation that the Sheraton hotel will be fine for the team's upcoming trip to Stockholm.

connections.description: Dale is part of a team requiring travel approval, and S is the administrative officer with authority to approve budget overages for their trip.

events.title: Planned Stockholm Interview Trip
events.description: A team from the U.S. Attorney's Office plans to travel to Stockholm, Sweden, to conduct an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Revised Stockholm Travel Dates
events.description: Alternative travel dates are proposed for flights to and from Stockholm (JFK to ARN via Paris) for the investigative interview.

events.title: Los Angeles Interview Trip
events.description: Prior travel for the Epstein investigation to Los Angeles for an interview.

events.title: West Palm Beach Interview Trip
events.description: Prior travel for the Epstein investigation to West Palm Beach, Florida, for an interview.

events.title: West Palm Beach Meetings Trip
events.description: Prior travel for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, for the case United States v. Epstein.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively conducting interviews internationally (Sweden) and domestically (LA, Florida) for the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618) into early 2020.
Travel logistics required specific approvals for costs exceeding government per diem rates, indicating official oversight of investigation expenses.
The document references the case as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
Multiple email addresses and names are redacted, indicating the correspondence involves several government personnel whose identities are protected in this release.
